name: Better Hacker News Design
description: A visual redesign of hacker news, trying to keep recognizable elements like the orange title bar, but improving some things of the orginal design which annoyed me.
additional_info:
0.4: Break long pre code blocks by applying white-space: pre-wrap; 0.3.9: Fix: Max-width of comments was broken in FF 46 0.3.8 Fix: Margin of downvotebutton for chrome *and* Firefox 0.3.7 Fix: Proper margins of downvote-button for chrome 0.3.6 Fix: Added max-width to counter one-line-comment attacks that stretched the whole page 0.3.5 Fix: Make maintenance warning visible 0.3.4
  • Fixed style for FF (votebutton alignments, background, font size, font color, link color)
  • Removed css for search, as that site was redesigned and code didn't apply anymore
0.3.3 Fix: Realign downvote button 0.3.2 Add lost ycombinator logo 0.3.1
  • Fixed: React to new HTML on HN, which broke the votebuttons of this design (doubled them)
  • Visited links now become a light blue, not grey (styling wasn't applied before because of a typo)
  • Footer is now as wide as the title area, for symmetry
0.3: Up/Downvote-arrows get blue on hover, which helps to click the right one when having both available 0.2.2: Fixed: Links at bottom were invisible 0.2.1: Fixed: Downvoted comments get gray again 0.2:
  • Highlighting of current top-navigation-link
  • Additional space between footer and site, important for threads without comments
0.1:
  • Bigger fonts (respecting browser-settings)
  • Higher contrast (almost black on white)
  • Colourful link, to better discover them and displaying the visited-state
  • Various visual improvements like increased line-height, vote-button aligned to position-number, more margins
  • Same style applied to the search
Based upon style 64417 and style 42951.
